articles.title: Walmart cuts starting pay for some new hires - WSJ
articles.content: Walmart is paying some new store workers less than it would have three months ago, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

articles.title: Factbox-Key dates on Trump's overlapping legal and political calendars
articles.content: Former U.S. President Donald Trump faces a tangled calendar in the year ahead as he seeks the 2024 Republican nomination while trying to fend off four criminal and three civil trials, some related to his attempts to overturn his 2020 loss.

articles.title: Shunning global summits, Xi visits flood-stricken area in northeast China
articles.content: Eschewing face-time with foreign leaders at global summits this week, Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday visited the homes of villagers in a rural part of northeast China battered by floods.

articles.title: Russian businessman gets 9 years in US prison for hack-and-trade scheme
articles.content: A Russian businessman with ties to the Kremlin was sentenced on Thursday to nine years in a U.S. prison after being convicted of participating in a $93 million insider-trading scheme involving hacked secret earnings information about multiple companies.

articles.title: French teenager dies after collision with police car, government urges calm
articles.content: PARIS (Reuters) -The French government on Thursday called for calm following the death of a 16-year-old boy whose motorbike collided with a police car on a road outside Paris.

articles.title: Boeing will meet 737 delivery goal despite new production problem -CFO
articles.content: WASHINGTON xx (Reuters) -Boeing is set to meet targets to deliver at least 400 narrowbody 737s this year, its chief financial officer said on Thursday, despite a recently discovered production flaw that has slowed deliveries of its bestselling 737 MAX.

articles.title: Exclusive-Kurdish-led Syria force vows to meet tribal demands after clash
articles.content: The head of the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) pledged to meet Arab tribal demands in eastern Syria and fix "mistakes" he said had been made in administering the region, seeking to defuse tensions that fuelled days of deadly fighting.

articles.title: Ukraine reports Danube port damage after latest Russian attack
articles.content: KYIV (Reuters) -Russia carried out its fourth drone attack in five days on Ukrainian port facilities on the Danube River on Thursday, damaging grain silos and other infrastructure on a vital export route for Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said.

articles.title: Russians vote in tightly controlled regional elections
articles.content: Russians finish voting on Sunday in tightly controlled regional and local elections that are likely to be interpreted by authorities as a vote of confidence in President Vladimir Putin.

articles.title: Factbox-U.S IPO market poised for strong finish in 2023 amid a flurry of listings
articles.content: U.S. investors are awaiting a slew of initial public offerings (IPO) in coming months, hoping to ride the recent rally in equity markets.

message.content:
Technology and Copyright Issues:
1. News Corp is in talks with artificial intelligence firms over content usage, avoiding legal action for now. Currently, legal responsibilities over AI copyright infringements are a grey area. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/news-corp-ai/news-corp-in-negotiations-with-ai-companies-over-content-usage-ceo-idUSKBN30D1GL))
2. Microsoft promises to shoulder legal damages for customers who might face lawsuits due to copyright infringements arising from using their AI products. This demonstrates Microsoft's commitment to stand by its customers. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/microsoft-ai/microsoft-to-defend-customers-on-ai-copyright-challenges-idUSKBN30D1GD))

Stock Market and Economy:
3. European shares fall due to China's wider clampdown on Apple iPhone usage by government staff, impacting chipmakers and miners. This underlines the effects of geopolitical tensions on international markets. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/europe-stocks/european-stocks-slip-dragged-lower-by-chipmakers-miners-idUSKBN30D0GQ))
4. Oil prices drop slightly due to uncertainty around demand from China, despite US reports showing strong crude demand. This demonstrates the impact of demand and supply dynamics in the global oil market. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/global-oil/oil-slips-on-weak-china-outlook-despite-us-stock-drawdown-idUSKBN30D01F))

Entertainment Industry Controversies:
5. The niece of J-pop mogul Johnny Kitagawa, accused of sexually abusing hundreds of boys, apologized and resigned from the talent agency he founded, showing the significant impact of the #MeToo movement in Japan.  (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/japan-entertainment-johnnys/niece-of-japans-johnny-kitagawa-resigns-from-j-pop-agency-apologises-for-his-abuse-idUSKBN30D0CT))

Political Developments and Social Issues:
6. A report from US Senator Chuck Grassley's office alleges decades of ignored corruption in Mexico by US officials during the drug war, highlighting the long-standing issues in US-Mexico relations. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/usa-mexico-security/us-officials-ignored-mexican-corruption-for-decades-during-drug-war-grassley-says-idUSKBN30D15Y))
7. Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva pleads for national unity on Independence Day, amidst political polarization and challenges in the country. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/brazil-independenceday/lula-calls-for-unity-as-brazil-celebrates-independence-day-idUSKBN30D0F6))

Industry Happenings:
8. General Motors offers workers 10% wage increase and additional lump-sum payments during contract talks with the Auto Workers union, signifying potential labor peace in the auto industries. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/autos-labor-uaw-gm/gm-offers-10-wage-hike-in-uaw-contract-talks-idUSKBN30D1EO))

Global Trade Frictions:
9. The US House Panel's Chair believes that China's wider ban on iPhone usage by state employees aims to limit Apple's market access, illustrating the ongoing tech rivalry between the US and China. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/china-apple-usa/us-house-panel-chair-wider-chinese-iphone-ban-aims-to-quash-apples-market-access-idUSKBN30D1EW))

Leadership Updates:
10. Chinese President Xi Jinping visits flood-stricken villages in northeast China instead of attending global summits, focusing on domestic issues over international engagements. (Full Story: [Reuters](reuters.com/article/china-politics-xi/shunning-global-summits-xi-visits-flood-stricken-area-in-northeast-china-idUSKBN30D17H))
